system.description: A cheap pack of sugarless gum. Flavor fades quickly.
A plastic lighter with a small amount of fuel remaining.
Disposable bottle of filtered water.
Dense, tasteless nutrition brick. URNC relief stamp on the wrapper.
Half-empty pack of cheap synthetic tobacco. Popular trade currency in Yellow Zones.
Thin plastic sheeting. Useful for improvised shelter or rain collection.
Worn canvas gloves with reinforced palms. Minimal protection from rough surfaces.
Plastic flashlight with dying batteries. Flickers occasionally.
Basic grooming item. Several teeth are missing.
Cardboard book with a handful of matches remaining. Advertising for a Green Zone bar.
Universal repair solution. About half remaining.
Single-use fare token for Green Zone public transit.
Just add hot water. Sodium content would concern a pre-war doctor.
Woven bracelet that unravels into several meters of utility cord.
Someone else's cancelled identification. Photo is water-damaged.
Bundle of plastic zip ties. Multiple uses, none of them gentle.
Faded cloth square. Dust mask, sweat rag, or tourniquet in a pinch.
Ballpoint pen and small spiral-bound notepad. Most of the pages are still blank.
Chemical light stick that burns bright red. Fifteen-minute duration.
Folding tool with pliers, knife, screwdriver heads, and a bottle opener. Well-worn but functional.
Dented metal water container. Holds about a liter.
Basic medical supplies: bandages, antiseptic wipes, painkillers. Nothing fancy.
Simple magnetic compass. Unreliable near Collapse hotspots.
Folding panel that trickle-charges devices. Takes all day in good sunlight.
Hands-free light with elastic strap. Red filter mode for night work.
Scratched optics but still serviceable. 8x magnification.
Nested cookware set with pot, pan, plate, and utensils.
Synthetic insulation rated to -5°C. Compresses into a stuff sack.
Chemical tablets that make questionable water drinkable. Bottle of 50.
Printed regional map with hand-annotated safe routes and danger zones.
Needles, thread, buttons, and patches. Essential for gear maintenance.
Three aluminum clips rated for moderate loads.
Mylar sheet that reflects body heat. Crinkles loudly.
Nylon climbing rope. Shows some wear but holds weight.
Ferro rod, striker, and tinder. Works when wet.
AM/FM receiver powered by manual dynamo. Picks up URNC emergency broadcasts.
Compact propane burner with wind screen. Hot food is good for morale.
Sturdy rucksack with multiple compartments. Faded PMC logo on the flap.
Disposable prepaid mobile. Limited minutes, no GPS tracking. Popular for obvious reasons.
Folding shovel with pick edge. Digging, cutting, prying—and other uses.
Gen 2 image intensifier. Green-tinted view of darkness. Battery life: 40 hours.
Heavy-duty cutters for chain, padlocks, and fencing. Not subtle.
Adjustable harness with gear loops. Rated for dynamic falls.
Socket set, wrenches, screwdrivers—everything needed for mechanical work.
Communication device that bypasses ground infrastructure. Expensive per-minute rates.
Small fuel-powered generator. Noisy but reliable. 2kW output.
Combat medical supplies: tourniquets, hemostatic agents, chest seals, decompression needles.
Detects conventional radiation only. Useless for Collapse, but still has applications.
Solid steel pry bar. Opens doors, crates, and arguments.
Pump-action filter that removes bacteria and particulates. 1000-liter capacity before replacement.
Professional picks, tension wrenches, and rakes in a leather case. Possession is legally questionable.
Handheld navigation unit with preloaded maps. Satellite coverage is patchy in some regions.
Small quadcopter with camera. 20-minute flight time, 500m range. Consumer model.
Two-person tent with basic weather resistance. Compact and quick to deploy.
Oxy-fuel torch for cutting through metal. Includes tanks with three hours of use.
Pair of handheld radios with 10km range. Unencrypted channels.
Specialized toolkit for field repairs on IOP-standard T-Dolls. Diagnostic cables, precision drivers, lubricant.
Handheld sensor that measures local Collapse radiation density. Essential for zone work.
Portable storage device compatible with IOP neural cloud extraction protocols. Holds one complete backup.
Single dose that resets ELID progression timer. Industrial production, URNC-certified.
Military-spec quadcopter with enhanced camera and signal range. 30-minute flight time, 2km range.
Pre-loaded injectors: stimulant, coagulant, broad-spectrum antibiotic, and analgesic.
Disrupts radio and cellular signals in a 50-meter radius. Highly illegal in Green Zones.
Military-grade handheld radios with frequency-hopping encryption. Set of two.
Universal blood substitute in a sealed bag. Field-stable for six months.
Detects heat signatures through darkness and light cover. Weapon-mountable.
Convincing documentation for zone transit. Quality varies. Single use before scrutiny.
Assorted IOP-standard parts: servos, actuators, synthetic skin patches, optical sensors.
Adaptive camouflage sheeting that shifts color to match surroundings. Defeats visual detection, not thermal.
Evidence collection and analysis tools. Fingerprint powder, luminol, sample containers, portable microscope.
Data storage device shielded against Collapse radiation interference. Rated for Red Zone operation.
Handheld diagnostic device for vitals, Collapse exposure levels, and ELID staging. Corporate medical standard.
Surgical instruments, sutures, local anesthetics, and sterile drapes for emergency operations.
Legal documentation granting residence in a specific Green Zone. Genuine, but obtained through gray channels.
Portable T-Doll repair station with diagnostic suite and component printer for minor parts.
Medical transport case with cold storage for vaccine preservation. A small fortune in the Yellow Zones.
24 complete meal packages from URNC military stocks. Calorie-dense, shelf-stable, joyless.
Monitors and records radio traffic in a wide frequency range. Decryption not included.
Legitimate (or legitimate-looking) URNC contractor identification. Opens doors, invites questions.
Functional cybernetic replacement with basic motor control. Industrial quality, not pretty.
Portable Collapse remediation node. Creates a 5-meter safe zone in Yellow-rated areas for 24 hours. Single use.
Portable hacking terminal with intrusion software suite. Standard issue for corporate security teams.
Replacement core processor for IOP T-Dolls. Blank—neural cloud transfer required.
Credentials providing limited query access to the URNC's twin administrative AIs. Monitored, of course.
Equipment for ELID stage reduction surgery. Requires trained operator. Single-use consumables included.
High-quality false identification as URNC military personnel. Will not survive deep verification.
Intact bottles of wine, sealed tobacco, vintage spirits, or similar luxuries from before the war.
Automated surgical pod for emergency operations. Handles trauma, not ELID. Requires power and consumables.
Lab-grown replacement organs preserved in stasis. Heart, liver, kidneys—not personalized but compatible.
Employee credentials for Girard Group facilities. Limited access tier but genuine.
Temporary authorization for 24-hour White Zone access. Does not include accommodation or return transit.
High-end cybernetic replacement with full sensory feedback and enhanced performance. Corporate executive grade.
High-capacity storage holding multiple T-Doll neural cloud backups. Often found in abandoned PMC facilities.
Miniaturized Collapse remediation equipment. Creates a 10-meter safe zone in Yellow-rated areas. Continuous operation.
Legal permanent residence in a White Zone enclave. Genuine documentation. How you afforded it is your business.
Authorization to produce T-Doll components and perform major repairs. Heavily regulated and taxed.
Cutting-edge pharmaceutical cocktail that may slow Late-Stage ELID progression. Unproven. Side effects unknown.
Recovered data storage containing pre-war records, research, or cultural archives. Contents vary wildly.
Complete cybernetic body replacement preserving the organic brain. Escape from ELID, embrace something else.
Authorization for independent operations in Purification or Yellow Zones without NOMFA oversight. Revocable.
Communication relay that taps into secure URNC networks. Passive monitoring only—active intrusion triggers alerts.
Contained sample of Collapse Fluid from a wartime detonation site. Research value is immense. So is the danger.
Complete chassis of a rare or discontinued T-Doll model. Neural cloud status unknown. Collectors pay fortunes.
Classified files on a specific target: person, organization, or location. How current the intel is matters.
Detailed mapping of a specific Black Zone including radiation patterns, terrain, and potential salvage sites.
Experimental technology allowing direct mental connection between human operators and T-Dolls. Untested long-term.
Identity package for a high-ranking oversight official. Commands resources and opens doors—briefly.
Legal claim and access codes to a surviving hardened facility. Condition and contents are part of the gamble.
Fragmentary documentation from the legendary AI researcher. Even partial data advances neural cloud theory by decades.
Laboratory-grade Collapse Fluid in containment. The foundation of weapons research and remediation science alike.
Authentication for inner government communications and systems. Expires quickly. Using them is treason.
Recovered cultural repository from a destroyed nation. Art, literature, history—proof that something existed.
Component or backup of the Soviet supercomputer AI. Even corrupted data is priceless to the right researchers.
Preserved consciousness of someone important—scientist, commander, or diplomat. Requires compatible hardware to access.
Full administrative access to one of the URNC's twin governing AIs. Functionally, keys to the kingdom.
Recovered processing element from Sangvis Ferri's master AI. Still active. Still thinking. Handle with caution.
A complete backup of Persicaria's Neural Cloud, Persica's personal AI assistant. A conversational companion and scientific genius.
Command authority over an operational orbital asset. Communication, surveillance, or something more dangerous.
Ownership of a self-contained White Zone habitat. Population included. Private nation in all but name.
The viral program that turns T-Dolls against their operators. Weapon of mass subversion. Possession is a death sentence.
The original signed document establishing the United Reactive Nationalist Coalition. Historical power, symbolic weight, and political ammunition.
The original IOP tactical doll demonstration unit. Neural cloud corrupted beyond recovery, but the chassis remains. Genesis of a species.
Full documentation of the Lycoris project—the origin of Collapse Fluid weaponization. The why and how of the apocalypse.
Fragment of the Pike Node's extraterrestrial artifact. The source of everything. Still active. Still dangerous. Still not understood.
The signed accord ending World War Three. Borders, reparations, reconstruction mandates—all written here. History's turning point in ink.
